sentences: Ma ei leidnud ühtki head restorani läheduses.
Ei oleks olnud ühtki selget vastust.
Tuleb teada võtta vähemalt üheksa korda kuus, aga mitte rohkem kui ühteksa korda.
context: The word 'ühtki' is an Estonian negative pronoun used to express the absence of something. It combines the negation particle 'ei' with the indefinite pronoun 'üks', meaning it functions as 'not even one' or 'no...at all'. This word is commonly used in contexts where you want to emphasize that there isn't any particular thing present or available.
